channel.title: How do you stay in shape?
channel.description:
I find it stupid and rather embarrassing at how many people are becoming overweight in America. It's one of the stereotypes that other countries have built on us. I know that some of you have very high metabolism, and you don't have to do jack shit to stay in shape. Unfortunately, I'm not one of those people, so I have to workout on a daily basis to keep in shape. How do you keep in shape?
I have sort of a routine now that I do on a daily basis (In less I'm busy), which goes as the following:
~ Stretching ~ P90x Ab Routine ~ DDR burn 300 calories (Workout mode) Really isn't that bad, takes about 45min out of my day.
[IMG]http://i99.photobucket.com/albums/l283/Metal798_2006/Photo0056.jpg[/img]
Been doing this routine since early August.

item.title: How do you stay in shape?
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:83, topic:381078”][quote author=r0ckstar96 link=topic=476893.msg3493629#msg3493629 date=1297117723]
I just eat 3 meals a day with some snacks and an apple here and there, and then I stay up late because I noticed that the later I stay up, the more weight I lose. I also sit at my computer almost all day as it keeps me preoccupied instead of getting up every 5 minutes to eat junk.
[/quote]

Heh yeah. Common misconception of us computer nerds, is that we are fat. When really, most computer nerds are scrawny and malnutritioned. Why? Because eating would take out of our computer time! :P[/quote]Most “computer nerds” are more or less compare to the gamers who never leave there seat and eat chips, pizza, etc all day and get fat.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you stay in shape?

r0ckstar96:

I just eat 3 meals a day with some snacks and an apple here and there, and then I stay up late because I noticed that the later I stay up, the more weight I lose. I also sit at my computer almost all day as it keeps me preoccupied instead of getting up every 5 minutes to eat junk.

Heh yeah. Common misconception of us computer nerds, is that we are fat. When really, most computer nerds are scrawny and malnutritioned. Why? Because eating would take out of our computer time!

item.title: How do you stay in shape?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“blakeman8192, post:80, topic:381078”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=476893.msg3493582#msg3493582 date=1297116334]

Heh, I’m 6’3".

America is fat because we eat way too much.
[/quote]This. Once I started eating less I started losing weight

Not all of us are that lucky though. I eat generally, a small bowl of cereal for breakfast, and about a medium sized plate for dinner. The plate being like, for example, a small burger and fries. I don’t eat much, and I will gain weight. Some people have a VERY low metabolism, and trust me, it sucks.

If you eat only twice a day you should expect to have a slow metabolism.
If you want to lose weight, eat 6 small meals (like snacks) a day. Constant food intake keeps your metabolism going.

lolwut I eat three meals per day

I said “if you want to lose weight,” not “if you want to stay skinny”, haha.[/quote]
oh lol

Read full topic

item.title: How do you stay in shape?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

England’s average height is much smaller than the USA’s.
I’m 6’, and 13 years old. In America, I’m an around of five inches taller than the average male my age.
When I visited Europe, most adults weren’t within reach of my height.

It was very different. :X

Read full topic

I’m average height for a 16 year old. 5’7"~, Not too sure since I haven’t taken a REAL physical since 9th grade. Step mom is a nurse and gets doctors to sign my physical forms.
[/quote]

THE FUCK?

I’m 13 and I’m 5"9 :|[/quote]

Average height. I’ve noticed a lot of people who sit around the 6’ mark whenever they get out of high school. I’m still growing though, lol.
